docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Get up and running with Inspekt in just 5 minutes! This hands-on tutorial will walk you through the basics and show you the power of browser automation from the command line.

Prerequisites

Make sure you've completed the Installation guide before starting this tutorial.

docs.title: Quick Start Workflow
docs.text:
Here's what we'll cover in this tutorial:

graph LR
    A[Execute JavaScript] --> B[Use REPL]
    B --> C[Extract Data]
    C --> D[Automate Tasks]
    D --> E[Advanced Features]

    style A fill:#e1f5ff
    style B fill:#fff4e1
    style C fill:#ffe1f5
    style D fill:#fff9e6
    style E fill:#e1ffe1

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to a Test Page
docs.text: Open your browser and navigate to https://example.com. Keep this tab active.

docs.title: Step 2: Execute JavaScript
docs.text:
Run your first command to get the page title:

inspekteval "document.title"

Expected output:

Example Domain

Congratulations! You just executed JavaScript in your browser from the terminal.

docs.title: Step 3: Try More Expressions
docs.text:
# Get the current URL
inspekteval "location.href"
# => https://example.com/

# Count paragraphs on the page
inspekteval "document.querySelectorAll('p').length"
# => 2

# Get all link URLs
inspekteval "Array.from(document.links).map(a => a.href)"
# => ["https://www.iana.org/domains/example"]

Quick Tip

The inspekteval command evaluates JavaScript expressions. For more complex code, use inspektexec with a file.

docs.title: Interactive REPL Session
docs.text:
The REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop) lets you experiment with JavaScript interactively:

inspektrepl

Try these commands in the REPL:

// Get the page title
zen> document.title
"Example Domain"

// Query the DOM
zen> document.querySelectorAll('h1')[0].textContent
"Example Domain"

// Create an array of links
zen> Array.from(document.links).map(a => ({text: a.textContent, href: a.href}))
[{text: "More information...", href: "https://www.iana.org/domains/example"}]

// Exit the REPL
zen> exit
Goodbye!

REPL Power

The REPL is perfect for exploring APIs, debugging, and prototyping JavaScript code before adding it to scripts.

docs.title: Extract Page Information
docs.text:
Use the info command to get comprehensive page details:

inspektinfo

Example output:

URL:      https://example.com
Title:    Example Domain
Domain:   example.com
Protocol: https:
State:    complete
Size:     1280x720

For extended information including language, meta tags, and cookies:

inspektinfo --extended

docs.title: Working with Links
docs.text: Navigate to a page with more links (like a news site or blog), then:

docs.title: List All Links
docs.text:
inspektlinks

Example output:

→ Home Page
  https://example.com/

→ About Us
  https://example.com/about

↗ External Resource
  https://other-site.com/page

Total: 15 links (12 internal, 3 external)

docs.title: Extract External Links Only
docs.text:
inspektlinks --only-external --only-urls

This outputs just the URLs, one per line - perfect for piping to other tools.

docs.title: Save Links to a File
docs.text: inspektlinks --only-urls > all-links.txt

docs.title: Get Enriched Link Metadata
docs.text:
inspektlinks --only-external --enrich-external

This fetches additional metadata like MIME types, file sizes, and HTTP status codes.

docs.title: Click an Element
docs.text:
# Click by CSS selector
inspektclick "button#submit"

# Double-click
inspektdouble-click "div.editable"

# Right-click (context menu)
inspektright-click "a.download"

docs.title: Highlight Elements
docs.text:
Useful for visual debugging:

# Highlight all headings
inspekthighlight "h1, h2, h3"

# Custom color
inspekthighlight "a" --color blue

# Clear highlights
inspekthighlight --clear

docs.title: Wait for Elements
docs.text:
Perfect for automation:

# Wait for element to exist (default: 30s timeout)
inspektwait "button#submit"

# Wait for element to be visible
inspektwait ".modal-dialog" --visible

# Wait for element to be hidden
inspektwait ".loading-spinner" --hidden

# Wait for text content
inspektwait "div.result" --text "Success"

# Custom timeout (10 seconds)
inspektwait "div.notification" --timeout 10

docs.title: View Heading Hierarchy
docs.text:
inspektoutline

Example output:

H1 Getting Started
   H2 Installation
      H3 Prerequisites
      H3 Setup
   H2 Configuration
      H3 Basic Settings
      H3 Advanced Options
         H4 Environment Variables

Total: 7 headings

This is great for:

  • Accessibility audits
  • SEO analysis
  • Understanding page structure

docs.title: Extract Table Data
docs.text: inspektexec zen/scripts/extract_table.js --format json > data.json

docs.title: Extract All Images
docs.text: inspektexec zen/scripts/extract_images.js --format json

docs.title: Get SEO Metadata
docs.text: inspektexec zen/scripts/extract_metadata.js --format json

docs.title: Custom Extraction
docs.text:
Extract product prices (example):

inspekteval "
  Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.product')).map(p => ({
    name: p.querySelector('.name').textContent,

pipx upgrade zen-bridge

docs.title: Automatic Updates (Recommended)
docs.text:
Since version 3.5, the userscript supports automatic updates:

  1. Tampermonkey/Violentmonkey will check for updates periodically (usually daily)
  2. You'll be prompted when an update is available
  3. Click "Update" to install the new version

To check manually:

  1. Open Tampermonkey/Violentmonkey dashboard
  2. Find "Zen Browser Bridge (WebSocket)"
  3. Click the "Check for updates" button
  4. Install if an update is available

docs.title: Manual Update
docs.text:
If you have version 3.4 or earlier (without auto-update):

  1. Open Tampermonkey/Violentmonkey dashboard
  2. Delete the old "Zen Browser Bridge" script
  3. Visit the raw userscript file: 
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/roelvangils/zen-bridge/main/userscript_ws.js
  4. Tampermonkey/Violentmonkey will prompt to install the new version
  5. Click "Install"
  6. Reload any open tabs to activate the new version

docs.title: Bash/Zsh Functions
docs.text:
Add these to your .bashrc or .zshrc:

# Quick page title
zt() {
  inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw
}

# Quick URL
zu() {
  inspekt eval "location.href" --format raw
}

# Extract all links
zlinks() {
  inspekt links --only-urls
}

# Count elements
zcount() {
  local selector="${1:-.item}"
  inspekt eval "document.querySelectorAll('$selector').length" --format raw
}

# Monitor element content
zwatch() {
  local selector="${1:-.main}"
  watch -n 5 "inspekt eval \"document.querySelector('$selector').textContent\" --format raw"
}

# Quick screenshot
zscreen() {
  local selector="${1:-body}"
  local output="screenshot-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S).png"
  inspekt screenshot --selector "$selector" --output "$output"
  echo "Saved: $output"
}

Create completions for your shell:

Bash: 

# ~/.bash_completion.d/zen
_zen_completion() {
  local cur prev commands
  cur="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CURS]}"
  prev="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CURS-1]}"

  commands="eval exec info repl server click wait send inspect links outline selected download summarize describe control"

  if [ $COMP_CWORD -eq 1 ]; then
    COMPREPLY=($(compgen -W "$commands" -- "$cur"))
  fi
}

complete -F _zen_completion zen

docs.title: Retry Logic
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash

retry_command() {
  local max_attempts=3
  local attempt=1
  local delay=2

  while [ $attempt -le $max_attempts ]; do
    echo "Attempt $attempt/$max_attempts..."

    if "$@"; then
      return 0
    fi

    if [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; then
      echo "Failed. Retrying in ${delay}s..."
      sleep $delay
      delay=$((delay * 2))
    fi

    attempt=$((attempt + 1))
  done

  echo "All attempts failed" >&2
  return 1
}

# Usage
retry_command inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.dynamic-content').textContent"

docs.title: Parallel Execution
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash

# Extract data from multiple pages in parallel
urls=(
  "https://example.com/page1"
  "https://example.com/page2"
  "https://example.com/page3"
)

pids=()

for url in "${urls[@]}"; do
  (
    echo "Processing: $url"
    inspekt open "$url" --wait
    title=$(inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw)
    links=$(inspekt links --only-urls | wc -l)
    echo "$url,$title,$links" >> results.csv
  ) &
  pids+=($!)
done

# Wait for all to complete
for pid in "${pids[@]}"; do
  wait "$pid"
done

echo "All pages processed"

docs.title: Data Scraping Workflow
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Scrape product data from multiple pages

output_file="products.jsonl"
base_url="https://example.com/products"
total_pages=5

> "$output_file"  # Clear file

for page in $(seq 1 $total_pages); do
  echo "Scraping page $page/$total_pages..."

  # Navigate
  inspekt open "${base_url}?page=${page}" --wait

  # Wait for products to load
  inspekt wait ".product" --visible

  # Extract data
  inspekt eval "
    Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.product')).map(p => ({
      name: p.querySelector('.product-name')?.textContent.trim(),
      price: p.querySelector('.product-price')?.textContent.trim(),
      rating: p.querySelector('.rating')?.textContent.trim(),
      image: p.querySelector('img')?.src,
      url: p.querySelector('a')?.href
    }))
  " --format json | jq -c '.[]' >> "$output_file"

  echo "Page $page complete"
  sleep 2  # Be polite
done

echo "Scraping complete. Total products: $(wc -l < "$output_file")"

docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Monitor page for changes and alert

url="https://example.com/status"
selector=".status-indicator"
check_interval=300  # 5 minutes
last_status=""

echo "Monitoring: $url"
echo "Selector: $selector"
echo "Interval: ${check_interval}s"

while true; do
  # Navigate and extract status
  inspekt open "$url" --wait
  current_status=$(inspekt eval "document.querySelector('$selector').textContent" --format raw)

  # Check for changes
  if [ -n "$last_status" ] && [ "$current_status" != "$last_status" ]; then
    echo "Status changed: $last_status → $current_status"

    # Send alert (macOS)
    osascript -e "display notification \"Status: $current_status\" with title \"Page Monitor\""

    # Or send email
    # echo "Status changed to: $current_status" | mail -s "Alert" user@example.com
  fi

  last_status="$current_status"
  echo "$(date): $current_status"

  sleep "$check_interval"
done

.git/hooks/pre-commit: 

#!/bin/bash

echo "Running browser tests..."

# Start server if not running
if ! inspekt server status &>/dev/null; then
  inspekt server start --daemon
  sleep 2
  cleanup=true
fi

# Run tests
inspekt open "file://$(pwd)/tests/index.html" --wait

result=$(inspekt eval "
  if (typeof runTests !== 'function') {
    return {error: 'runTests not found'};
  }
  return runTests();
" --format json)

failed=$(echo "$result" | jq -r '.failed // 0')

# Cleanup if we started the server
if [ "$cleanup" = "true" ]; then
  pkill -f "inspekt server"
fi

# Check results
if [ "$failed" -gt 0 ]; then
  echo "Tests failed! Commit aborted."
  echo "$result" | jq '.'
  exit 1
fi

echo "All tests passed!"

docs.title: Caching Results
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash

cache_dir="$HOME/.zen-cache"
cache_ttl=300  # 5 minutes

mkdir -p "$cache_dir"

get_cached_or_fetch() {
  local key="$1"
  local command="$2"
  local cache_file="$cache_dir/$(echo "$key" | md5sum | cut -d' ' -f1)"

  # Check cache
  if [ -f "$cache_file" ]; then
    age=$(($(date +%s) - $(stat -c %Y "$cache_file")))
    if [ $age -lt $cache_ttl ]; then
      cat "$cache_file"
      return 0
    fi
  fi

  # Fetch and cache
  result=$(eval "$command")
  echo "$result" > "$cache_file"
  echo "$result"
}

# Usage
title=$(get_cached_or_fetch "page-title" "inspekt eval 'document.title' --format raw")

docs.title: AI Features
docs.text: Master AI-powered features in Inspekt. Learn how to generate article summaries, create page descriptions for accessibility, and configure AI integration with mods.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Inspekt integrates with AI through mods to provide two powerful features:

  • inspekt summarize - Generate concise article summaries
  • inspekt describe - Create accessible page descriptions for screen readers

Both commands extract page content and use AI to generate natural-language output.

docs.title: Install mods
docs.text:
AI features require mods to be installed:

# macOS/Linux
brew install charmbracelet/tap/mods

# Or with go
go install github.com/charmbracelet/mods@latest

docs.title: Configure mods
docs.text:
On first run, mods will prompt you to configure an AI provider:

mods

Supported providers: - OpenAI (GPT-3.5, GPT-4) - Anthropic (Claude) - Ollama (local models) - Azure OpenAI - And more...

Set your API key:

# OpenAI
export OPENAI_API_KEY="your-key-here"

# Anthropic
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="your-key-here"

# Or configure via mods
mods --settings

docs.title: Article Summarization
docs.text: The inspekt summarize command extracts article content and generates a concise summary.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
inspekt summarize

Example output: 

This article discusses the importance of web accessibility and provides
practical techniques for making websites more inclusive. Key points include
semantic HTML, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and screen reader compatibility.
The author emphasizes that accessibility benefits all users, not just those with
disabilities, by improving usability and SEO.

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
1. Extract Article - Uses Mozilla Readability to extract main content
  2. Detect Language - Automatically detects page language
  3. Generate Summary - Sends content to AI via mods
  4. Return Result - Displays concise summary

docs.title: Show Full Article

Displays the extracted article content without summarizing:

Author: John Doe
Published: 2024-01-15

[Full extracted article text]

docs.text:
1. CLI flag (--language) - Highest priority
  2. Config file (ai-language setting) - Second priority
  3. Page language (HTML lang attribute) - Third priority

docs.title: Page Descriptions for Screen Readers
docs.text: The inspekt describe command generates natural-language page descriptions perfect for blind users.

This webpage is in Dutch, but is also available in English and French.
At the top you can navigate to services, articles, careers, about us
and contact us. The main part contains a rather long article about an
empathy lab with five headings. The footer contains standard links
such as a sitemap and privacy statement.

docs.title: What It Analyzes
docs.text:
The describe command extracts:

  • Available languages - Alternate language versions
  • Navigation menus - Main navigation structure
  • Page landmarks - Headers, main content, footer, etc.
  • Heading structure - H1-H6 hierarchy and count
  • Main content type - Article, form, list, etc.
  • Content length - Approximate reading time
  • Significant images - Alt text and image count
  • Forms - Input fields and their purposes
  • Footer utilities - Links like privacy policy, sitemap

docs.title: Basic Commands
docs.text: Learn the essential commands for everyday use with Inspekt. This guide covers the most common commands you'll use for executing code, getting page information, managing the server, and working interactively.

docs.title: Server Management
docs.text: Before you can use any commands, the bridge server must be running.

docs.title: Starting the Server
docs.text:
Background Mode (Recommended)Foreground ModeCustom Port 
inspekt server start --daemon

Starts the server in the background. You can close your terminal and the server keeps running.

inspekt server start

Starts the server in foreground mode. Useful for debugging. Press Ctrl+C to stop.

inspekt server start --port 9000 --daemon

Start on a different port (default is 8765).

Auto-start on Login

On macOS/Linux, you can create a launch agent or systemd service to start the server automatically when you log in.

docs.title: Checking Server Status
docs.text:
inspekt server status

Example output: 

Bridge server is running
  Pending requests:   0
  Completed requests: 42

Shows: - Whether the server is running - Number of pending requests - Total completed requests since server started

docs.title: Stopping the Server
docs.text:
inspekt server stop

Only works if the server is running in foreground mode. For daemon mode, use:

pkill -f "inspekt server"

Daemon Mode Limitation

There's no built-in daemon stop command yet. Use pkill as shown above.

docs.title: Executing JavaScript Code
docs.text: The inspekt eval command is your primary way to execute JavaScript in the browser.

docs.title: Basic Syntax
docs.text: inspekt eval "javascript_code_here"

docs.title: Simple Expressions
docs.text:
Get quick information from the page:

# Page title
inspekt eval "document.title"
# Output: Example Domain

# Page URL
inspekt eval "location.href"
# Output: https://example.com/

# Number of links
inspekt eval "document.links.length"
# Output: 15

# Get domain
inspekt eval "location.hostname"
# Output: example.com

docs.title: Complex Expressions
docs.text:
Use arrays, objects, and methods:

# Extract all links
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).map(a => a.href)"

# Get multiple properties
inspekt eval "({url: location.href, title: document.title, links: document.links.length})"

# Filter elements
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('a')).filter(a => a.hostname !== location.hostname).map(a => a.href)"

docs.title: Multi-line Code
docs.text:
For complex logic, use proper JavaScript syntax:

inspekt eval "
  const links = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('a'));
  const internal = links.filter(a => a.hostname === location.hostname);
  const external = links.filter(a => a.hostname !== location.hostname);
  return {
    total: links.length,
    internal: internal.length,
    external: external.length
  };
"

Semicolons Matter

When using multiple statements, separate them with semicolons. The last expression is automatically returned.

docs.title: Using stdin
docs.text:
Pipe JavaScript code from files or other commands:

# From a file
cat script.js | inspekt eval

# From echo
echo "document.title" | inspekt eval

# From heredoc
inspekt eval <<'EOF'
const images = document.querySelectorAll('img');
return Array.from(images).map(img => ({
  src: img.src,
  alt: img.alt,
  width: img.naturalWidth,
  height: img.naturalHeight
}));
EOF

docs.text: The inspekt exec command executes JavaScript from a file.

inspekt exec script.js

Same as: 

inspekt eval --file script.js

// Extract all product information
const products = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.product'));
return products.map(product => ({
  name: product.querySelector('.product-name').textContent,
  price: product.querySelector('.product-price').textContent,
  rating: product.querySelector('.product-rating')?.textContent,
  image: product.querySelector('.product-image')?.src
}));

Execute: 

inspekt exec script.js --format json > products.json

{state: {...}, config: {...}}

zen> window.myApp.state
{user: {...}, settings: {...}}

docs.title: Output Formatting
docs.text: Control how results are displayed using the --format flag.

docs.title: Format Options
docs.text: Format Description Best For auto (default) Smart formatting based on output type General use json Valid JSON output Piping to jq, scripts raw Plain text, no formatting Shell variables, parsing

docs.title: Auto Format (Default)
docs.text:
inspekt eval "document.title"

Intelligently formats based on the result type: - Strings: plain text - Objects/Arrays: pretty-printed JSON - Numbers: plain text - undefined/null: "(empty)"

docs.title: JSON Format
docs.text:
inspekt eval "({title: document.title, url: location.href})" --format json

Output: 

{
  "title": "Example Domain",
  "url": "https://example.com"
}

Perfect for piping to jq: 

inspekt eval "({title: document.title, url: location.href})" --format json | jq '.title'

docs.title: Raw Format
docs.text:
inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw

Output: 

Example Domain

No extra formatting - perfect for shell variables: 

TITLE=$(inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw)
echo "Page title is: $TITLE"

docs.title: Adding Metadata
docs.text:
Add URL and title to output:

# Add URL
inspekt eval "document.links.length" --url

# Add title
inspekt eval "document.links.length" --title

# Add both
inspekt eval "document.links.length" --url --title

Output: 

URL: https://example.com
Title: Example Domain

15

docs.title: Timeout Control
docs.text:
Commands have a default 10-second timeout. Adjust for slow operations.

# Default timeout (10 seconds)
inspekt eval "document.title"

# Custom timeout (30 seconds)
inspekt eval "await slowOperation()" --timeout 30

# Short timeout (5 seconds)
inspekt eval "document.title" --timeout 5

Timeouts

If a command takes longer than the timeout, you'll see: 

Error: Request timed out after 10 seconds

Increase the timeout with --timeout.

docs.title: Userscript Information
docs.text:
View installation instructions for the browser userscript.

inspekt userscript

Displays: - Installation instructions - Userscript manager links (Violentmonkey, Tampermonkey) - How to view the userscript code

docs.title: Get Page Data
docs.text:
# Title
inspekt eval "document.title"

# URL
inspekt eval "location.href"

# Domain
inspekt eval "location.hostname"

# Full page info
inspekt info

docs.title: Count Elements
docs.text:
# All links
inspekt eval "document.links.length"

# All images
inspekt eval "document.images.length"

# Specific selector
inspekt eval "document.querySelectorAll('.product').length"

docs.title: Extract Text
docs.text:
# Page text
inspekt eval "document.body.textContent"

# Heading text
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('h1').textContent"

# All headings
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('h1,h2,h3')).map(h => h.textContent)"

docs.title: Check Existence
docs.text:
# Element exists
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.modal') !== null"

# Element visible
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.modal')?.offsetParent !== null"

docs.title: Common Errors
docs.text:
Server not running: 

Error: Bridge server is not running
Please start the server with: inspekt server start

Solution: Start the server with inspekt server start --daemon

No browser connection: 

Error: No response from browser

Solutions: - Ensure the userscript is installed and enabled - Open a browser tab (userscript only works in active tabs) - Check browser console for errors - Refresh the page

Timeout: 

Error: Request timed out after 10 seconds

Solution: Increase timeout with --timeout 30

JavaScript error: 

TypeError: Cannot read property 'click' of null

Solution: Check your selectors - element may not exist

docs.title: Use Shell Variables
docs.text:
TITLE=$(inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw)
URL=$(inspekt eval "location.href" --format raw)

echo "Title: $TITLE"
echo "URL: $URL"

docs.title: Pipe to Other Tools
docs.text:
# Count links
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).map(a => a.href).join('\n')" --format raw | wc -l

# Filter with grep
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).map(a => a.href).join('\n')" --format raw | grep "github"

# Process with jq
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).map(a => ({text: a.textContent, href: a.href}))" --format json | jq '.[0]'

docs.title: Async/Await Support
docs.text: inspekt eval "await fetch('/api/data').then(r => r.json())"

docs.text:
inspekt eval "console.log('Debug info'); document.title"

Check your browser console to see the log output.

docs.title: Control Mode
docs.text: Master keyboard-only navigation with Inspekt Control Mode. Navigate pages entirely from your terminal using Tab, Enter, and Arrow keys.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
inspekt control provides keyboard-only navigation for accessibility testing and hands-free browsing. It's perfect for:

  • Accessibility testing - Verify keyboard navigation
  • Hands-free browsing - Navigate without a mouse
  • Screen reader compatibility - Test with keyboard + voice
  • Focus management testing - Verify focus indicators
  • Navigation persistence - Auto-refocus after page loads

docs.title: Starting Control Mode
docs.text:
inspekt control

What happens:

  1. Terminal enters raw mode (captures all keyboard input)
  2. Browser receives keyboard events in real-time
  3. Focus indicators appear on interactive elements
  4. Terminal displays announcements and feedback
  5. Mode persists across page navigations

To exit: Press Ctrl+D or q

docs.title: Basic Controls
docs.text: Key Action Tab Navigate forward through focusable elements Shift+Tab Navigate backward Enter Activate focused element (click/submit) Space Activate focused element Arrow Keys Navigate directionally Escape Return focus to body q Quit control mode Ctrl+D Quit control mode

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
Control mode captures your keystrokes and sends them to the browser:

  1. You press Tab in terminal
  2. Zen sends Tab to browser
  3. Browser shifts focus to next element
  4. Element is highlighted with blue outline
  5. Terminal announces element name and role

docs.title: Visual Feedback
docs.text: Focused elements get a blue outline (outline: 2px solid blue) so you can see what's focused.

docs.title: Terminal Announcements
docs.text:
Control mode announces element details in your terminal:

Focus: Submit Button (button)
Focus: Email Input (input)
Focus: Privacy Policy (link)

docs.title: Auto-refocus After Navigation
docs.text:
Control mode persists across page navigations:

inspekt control
# Tab to a link
# Press Enter → Page loads
# → Focus automatically returns to the link
# Continue tabbing from there

This is unique to Inspekt - the focus persists even after navigation!

docs.title: Text-to-Speech (macOS)
docs.text:
Enable voice announcements:

# Set in config.json
{
  "control": {
    "speak-all": true
  }
}

Focused elements are announced via macOS say command:

"Submit Button"
"Email Input"
"Privacy Policy Link"

Perfect for testing screen reader workflows without actual screen reader.

docs.title: Accessibility Names
docs.text:
Control mode extracts accessible names for elements:

  • aria-label attribute
  • aria-labelledby reference
  • Associated <label> text
  • Button/link text content
  • alt text for images
  • title attribute

This matches what screen readers announce!

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Edit config.json in project root:

{
  "control": {
    "verbose": true,
    "speak-all": true,
    "verbose-logging": false
  }
}

Options:

  • verbose (default: true) - Show terminal announcements
  • speak-all (default: true) - Enable text-to-speech on macOS
  • verbose-logging (default: false) - Detailed debug output

docs.title: Example 1: Form Navigation
docs.text:
inspekt control

# Tab to first field → "Email Input"
# Type: test@example.com
# Tab to next field → "Password Input"
# Type: password123
# Tab to submit → "Submit Button"
# Press Enter → Form submits
# → Focus returns to submit button after page loads

docs.title: Example 2: Link Navigation
docs.text:
inspekt control

# Tab through navigation → "Home", "About", "Contact"
# Tab to main content link → "Read More"
# Press Enter → Article opens
# → Focus returns to "Read More" link position
# Continue navigating from there

docs.title: Example 3: Modal Interaction
docs.text:
inspekt control

# Tab to button → "Open Modal"
# Press Enter → Modal opens
# Tab through modal → "Close Button", "Save Button"
# Press Enter on "Close" → Modal closes
# Continue navigating

docs.title: Example 4: Accessibility Audit
docs.text:
inspekt control

# Tab through entire page
# Verify:
# - All interactive elements reachable?
# - Focus indicators visible?
# - Logical tab order?
# - No focus traps?
# - Keyboard shortcuts work?

docs.title: Combine with Other Commands
docs.text:
Take screenshots of focused elements: 

# Start control mode in one terminal
inspekt control

# In another terminal:
inspekt eval "document.activeElement"
inspekt screenshot --selector "$0" --output focused.png

Extract focused element info: 

# While in control mode (other terminal):
inspekt eval "
  const el = document.activeElement;
  return {
    tag: el.tagName,
    text: el.textContent,
    role: el.getAttribute('role'),
    label: el.getAttribute('aria-label')
  };
" --format json

Verify focus order: 

# While in control mode (other terminal):
inspekt eval "
  const focusable = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll(
    'a, button, input, select, textarea, [tabindex]:not([tabindex=\"-1\"])'
  ));
  return focusable.map((el, i) => ({
    index: i,
    tag: el.tagName,
    text: el.textContent?.substring(0, 30),
    tabIndex: el.tabIndex
  }));
" --format json

docs.title: Test Focus Traps
docs.text:
inspekt control

# Navigate into component
# Try to Tab out
# If trapped → Accessibility issue!

docs.title: Test Skip Links
docs.text:
inspekt control

# First Tab should focus skip link
# Press Enter
# Verify focus jumps to main content

docs.title: Test Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text:
inspekt control

# Try:
# - Ctrl+F for search
# - Escape to close modals
# - Arrow keys for sliders
# - Space for checkboxes

docs.title: 1. Accessibility Testing
docs.text:
Verify keyboard navigation compliance:

  • All interactive elements reachable via Tab
  • Logical tab order (left-to-right, top-to-bottom)
  • Focus indicators visible
  • No keyboard traps
  • Skip links present and functional
  • Modals trap focus appropriately
  • Dropdowns navigable with arrows
  • Forms completable without mouse

docs.title: 2. Screen Reader Testing
docs.text:
Test with keyboard + voice:

# Enable text-to-speech
# Edit config.json: "speak-all": true

inspekt control
# Navigate and listen to announcements
# Verify meaningful names
# Check announcement order

docs.title: 3. Focus Management Testing
docs.text:
Test focus behavior:

inspekt control
# Open modal → Focus should enter modal
# Close modal → Focus should return to trigger
# Submit form → Focus should go to success message
# Navigate → Focus should persist (unique to Inspekt!)

docs.title: 4. Keyboard-Only Workflows
docs.text:
Browse without a mouse:

inspekt control
# Navigate entirely from terminal
# Perfect for accessibility demos
# Great for focus management testing

docs.title: 1. Terminal Setup
docs.text:
import sys, tty, termios

# Save terminal settings
old_settings = termios.tcgetattr(sys.stdin)

# Enter raw mode (no buffering, no echo)
tty.setraw(sys.stdin)

docs.title: 2. Key Capture Loop
docs.text:
while True:
    char = sys.stdin.read(1)  # Read single character

    # Handle special keys
    if char == '\t':  # Tab
        send_key_to_browser('Tab')
    elif char == '\r':  # Enter
        send_key_to_browser('Enter')
    # ... etc

docs.title: 3. Browser Script
docs.text:
// control.js (injected in browser)
document.addEventListener('zenControl', (event) => {
  const {key, shiftKey, ctrlKey, altKey} = event.detail;

  // Simulate keyboard event
  const keyEvent = new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {
    key, shiftKey, ctrlKey, altKey,
    bubbles: true
  });

  document.activeElement.dispatchEvent(keyEvent);
});

docs.title: 4. Focus Tracking
docs.text:
document.addEventListener('focus', (event) => {
  const element = event.target;

  // Highlight focused element
  element.style.outline = '2px solid blue';

  // Send announcement to terminal
  const name = getAccessibleName(element);
  sendToTerminal(`Focus: ${name}`);
}, true);

docs.title: 5. Auto-refocus
docs.text:
// Store focused element before navigation
let lastFocused = null;

document.addEventListener('focus', (e) => {
  lastFocused = e.target;
}, true);

// Restore after page load
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
  if (lastFocused) {
    lastFocused.focus();
  }
});

docs.title: config.json
docs.text:
{
  "control": {
    "verbose": true,
    "speak-all": true,
    "verbose-logging": false
  }
}

docs.title: Verbose Mode
docs.text:
Enabled (default): 

Focus: Submit Button (button)
Focus: Email Input (input)
Activated: Submit Button

Disabled: 

(no terminal output)

docs.title: Text-to-Speech
docs.text:
Enabled (macOS only): 

# Uses `say` command
say "Submit Button"
say "Email Input"

Disabled (default on Linux): 

(no voice output)

docs.title: Keys Not Working
docs.text:
Problem: Keys pressed but nothing happens in browser

Solutions: 1. Verify browser tab is active 2. Check userscript is running 3. Refresh page 4. Restart control mode

docs.title: Focus Not Visible
docs.text:
Problem: Can't see what's focused

Solutions: 1. Check element has focus styles 2. Try forcing outline: 

inspekt eval "document.activeElement.style.outline = '3px solid red'"
3. Some elements have outline: none - accessibility issue!

docs.title: Control Mode Exits Immediately
docs.text:
Problem: Mode starts and exits right away

Solutions: 1. Don't press q or Ctrl+D immediately 2. Check terminal supports raw mode 3. Try inspekt control --help first

docs.title: Can't Exit Control Mode
docs.text:
Problem: Can't quit with q or Ctrl+D

Solutions: 1. Press Ctrl+C (force quit) 2. Close terminal window 3. Restart terminal

docs.title: Voice Not Working
docs.text:
Problem: No text-to-speech on macOS

Solutions: 1. Verify say command works: say "test" 2. Check config: "speak-all": true 3. macOS only - not available on Linux/Windows

docs.title: 1. Test on Real Content
docs.text:
Don't just test on example pages - test your actual site:

inspekt control
# Navigate your production site
# Verify real user workflows

docs.title: 2. Document Issues
docs.text:
Create accessibility audit reports:

# While in control mode, document issues:
# - Elements not reachable
# - Poor focus indicators
# - Illogical tab order
# - Keyboard traps

docs.title: 3. Compare with Screen Readers
docs.text:
Test with actual screen readers too:

  • NVDA (Windows)
  • JAWS (Windows)
  • VoiceOver (macOS)
  • Orca (Linux)

Inspekt control mode is a supplement, not a replacement.

docs.title: 4. Test Different Browsers
docs.text:
Keyboard behavior varies by browser:

# Test in Chrome
inspekt control

# Test in Firefox
inspekt control

# Test in Safari
inspekt control

docs.title: Data Extraction
docs.text: Master data extraction with Inspekt. Learn how to extract links, generate page outlines, get selected text, download files, and extract structured data from web pages.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Inspekt provides specialized commands for data extraction:

  • inspekt links - Extract and analyze links
  • inspekt outline - Display page heading structure
  • inspekt selected - Get selected text
  • inspekt download - Find and download files
  • inspekt info - Get page metadata

docs.title: Extracting Links
docs.text: The inspekt links command extracts all links from a page with powerful filtering options.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
inspekt links

Output: 

→ Home Page
  https://example.com/

↗ External Resource
  https://other-site.com/page

Total: 15 links (8 internal, 7 external)

Shows: - Link text (anchor text) - URL - Internal (→) vs External (↗) indicators - Summary count

docs.title: Filter to Internal Links
docs.text:
inspekt links --only-internal

Shows only links to the same domain.

docs.title: Filter to External Links
docs.text:
inspekt links --only-external

Shows only links to other domains.

docs.title: URLs Only
docs.text:
inspekt links --only-urls

Outputs just URLs (one per line), perfect for piping:

https://example.com/page1
https://example.com/page2
https://external.com/resource

docs.title: Alphabetical Sorting
docs.text:
inspekt links --alphabetically

Sorts links alphabetically by URL.

docs.title: Link Enrichment
docs.text:
Get detailed metadata for external links:

inspekt links --enrich-external

Fetches: - HTTP status code - MIME type (content-type) - File size - Page title - Language

Example output: 

↗ Documentation
  https://docs.example.com/
  Status: 200 OK | Type: text/html | Size: 42KB | Lang: en
  Title: Example Docs - Getting Started

docs.title: JSON Output
docs.text:
inspekt links --json

Outputs structured JSON for scripting:

{
  "links": [
    {
      "text": "Home Page",
      "url": "https://example.com/",
      "internal": true
    },
    {
      "text": "External Resource",
      "url": "https://other-site.com/page",
      "internal": false,
      "status": 200,
      "contentType": "text/html",
      "size": 42170,
      "title": "Resource Title",
      "language": "en"
    }
  ],
  "summary": {
    "total": 15,
    "internal": 8,
    "external": 7
  }
}

docs.title: Combined Filters
docs.text:
# External URLs only, alphabetically sorted
inspekt links --only-external --only-urls --alphabetically

# Internal links as JSON
inspekt links --only-internal --json

# External links with enrichment
inspekt links --only-external --enrich-external

docs.title: Practical Uses
docs.text:
Export links for analysis: 

inspekt links --only-external --only-urls > external-links.txt

Count total links: 

inspekt links --only-urls | wc -l

Find PDF links: 

inspekt links --only-urls | grep "\.pdf$"

Check broken links: 

inspekt links --only-urls | xargs -I {} curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code} {}\n" {}

Extract and process with jq: 

inspekt links --json | jq '.links[] | select(.internal == false) | .url'

docs.title: Page Outline
docs.text: Display the heading hierarchy of a page for accessibility audits and SEO analysis.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
inspekt outline

Output: 

H1 Getting Started
   H2 Installation
      H3 Prerequisites
      H3 Setup
   H2 Configuration
      H3 Basic Settings
      H3 Advanced Options
         H4 Environment Variables

Total: 7 headings

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Native HTML headings - H1-H6 elements
  • ARIA headings - Elements with role="heading" and aria-level
  • Hierarchical indentation - Visual tree structure
  • Colored output - Level labels in gray, text in white

docs.title: Use Cases
docs.text:
Accessibility audit: 

inspekt outline
# Check for:
# - Single H1
# - Proper nesting (no skipped levels)
# - Logical hierarchy

SEO analysis: 

inspekt outline | grep "H1"
# Should find exactly one H1

Content structure: 

inspekt outline > page-structure.txt
# Document page organization

Compare pages: 

inspekt outline > page1.txt
# Navigate to another page
inspekt outline > page2.txt
diff page1.txt page2.txt

docs.title: Selected Text
docs.text: Get the currently selected text with metadata.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
inspekt selected

Output: 

Selected Text:
"This is the selected text on the page."

Position: 42-78 (36 characters)
Container: DIV.content
Parent: ARTICLE.post

Shows: - Selected text - Character position - Container element - Parent element

docs.title: Raw Text Only
docs.text:
inspekt selected --raw

Output: 

This is the selected text on the page.

Just the text, no metadata - perfect for piping.

docs.title: Practical Uses
docs.text:
Copy to clipboard (macOS): 

inspekt selected --raw | pbcopy

Save to file: 

inspekt selected --raw > selection.txt

Process with other tools: 

inspekt selected --raw | wc -w  # Count words
inspekt selected --raw | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]'  # Lowercase

Translate selection: 

inspekt selected --raw | translate-tool

docs.title: Download Files
docs.text: Find and download files interactively from the current page.

docs.title: Interactive Mode
docs.text:
inspekt download

Presents an interactive menu to select files:

Found 15 downloadable files:

IMAGES (8 files)
  1. hero-image.jpg (1920x1080)
  2. logo.png (400x200)
  ...

PDF DOCUMENTS (3 files)
  9. user-guide.pdf
  10. report.pdf
  ...

Select files to download (comma-separated, or 'all'):
>

docs.title: List Files Only
docs.text:
inspekt download --list

Shows available files without downloading.

docs.title: Custom Output Directory
docs.text:
inspekt download --output ~/Downloads/example-com

Downloads to a specific directory.

docs.title: Custom Timeout
docs.text:
inspekt download --timeout 60

For large files or slow connections (default: 30s).

docs.title: Supported File Types
docs.text:
Images: - jpg, jpeg, png, gif, svg, webp, bmp, ico

Documents: - pdf, docx, xlsx, pptx, txt, csv, md

Videos: - mp4, webm, avi, mov, mkv, flv

Audio: - mp3, wav, ogg, m4a, flac

Archives: - zip, rar, tar, gz, tar.gz, 7z, bz2

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
The download command:

  1. Searches for downloadable files:
  2. <img> elements
  3. <a> elements linking to files
  4. <video> and <audio> sources
  5. CSS background images

  6. Data URLs

  7. Categorizes files by type

  8. Presents interactive selection menu

  9. Downloads selected files in parallel

  10. Shows progress and file sizes

docs.title: Practical Uses
docs.text:
Download all images: 

inspekt download
# Select "Download all IMAGES"

Download PDFs from documentation: 

inspekt download --output ~/Documents/docs
# Select PDF files

Batch download resources: 

# Navigate to resource page
inspekt download --output ~/Downloads/resources

docs.title: Page Information
docs.text: Get comprehensive metadata about the current page.

docs.title: Basic Info
docs.text:
inspekt info

Output: 

URL:      https://example.com
Title:    Example Domain
Domain:   example.com
Protocol: https:
State:    complete
Size:     1280x720

docs.title: Extended Information
docs.text:
inspekt info --extended

Includes:

Language & Encoding: - Page language - Character set - Direction (LTR/RTL)

Meta Tags: - Description - Keywords - Viewport settings - Author

Resources: - Script count - Stylesheet count - Image count - Cookie count

Security: - HTTPS status - Mixed content warnings - Content Security Policy - Referrer policy - Robots meta tags

Accessibility: - Landmark count - Heading structure - Alt text issues - ARIA labels

SEO: - Canonical URL - Open Graph tags - Twitter Card tags - Structured data (JSON-LD) - Robots directives

Performance: - localStorage size - sessionStorage size - Service worker status

docs.title: JSON Output
docs.text:
inspekt info --json

Structured JSON for parsing:

inspekt info --json | jq '.url'
inspekt info --json | jq '.title'
inspekt info --json | jq '.extended.seo.canonical'

docs.title: Advanced Extraction with eval
docs.text: For custom extraction needs, use inspekt eval:

docs.title: Extract Table Data
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  const table = document.querySelector('table');
  const headers = Array.from(table.querySelectorAll('th')).map(th => th.textContent.trim());
  const rows = Array.from(table.querySelectorAll('tbody tr')).map(tr =>
    Array.from(tr.cells).map(cell => cell.textContent.trim())
  );
  return {headers, rows};
" --format json > table.json

docs.title: Extract Product Data
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.product')).map(product => ({
    name: product.querySelector('.product-name').textContent.trim(),
    price: product.querySelector('.product-price').textContent.trim(),
    rating: product.querySelector('.rating')?.textContent,
    image: product.querySelector('img')?.src,
    available: !product.classList.contains('out-of-stock')
  }))
" --format json > products.json

docs.title: Extract Article Content
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  ({
    title: document.querySelector('h1')?.textContent,
    author: document.querySelector('.author')?.textContent,
    date: document.querySelector('time')?.getAttribute('datetime'),
    content: document.querySelector('article')?.textContent.trim(),
    tags: Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.tag')).map(t => t.textContent.trim())
  })
" --format json > article.json

docs.title: Extract All Images
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  Array.from(document.images).map(img => ({
    src: img.src,
    alt: img.alt,
    width: img.naturalWidth,
    height: img.naturalHeight,
    title: img.title,
    loading: img.loading
  }))
" --format json > images.json

docs.title: Extract Meta Tags
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  const meta = {};
  document.querySelectorAll('meta').forEach(tag => {
    const name = tag.name || tag.property;
    if (name) meta[name] = tag.content;
  });
  return meta;
" --format json > meta.json

docs.title: Extract Forms
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  Array.from(document.forms).map(form => ({
    action: form.action,
    method: form.method,
    id: form.id,
    fields: Array.from(form.elements)
      .filter(el => el.name)
      .map(el => ({
        name: el.name,
        type: el.type,
        required: el.required,
        placeholder: el.placeholder
      }))
  }))
" --format json > forms.json

docs.title: Extract Structured Data (JSON-LD)
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('script[type=\"application/ld+json\"]'))
    .map(script => JSON.parse(script.textContent))
" --format json > structured-data.json

docs.title: Text Normalization
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  const text = document.querySelector('.content').textContent;
  return text
    .trim()
    .replace(/\s+/g, ' ')      // Multiple spaces to single
    .replace(/\n+/g, '\n');     // Multiple newlines to single
" --format raw

docs.title: HTML Stripping
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  const html = document.querySelector('.content').innerHTML;
  const temp = document.createElement('div');
  temp.innerHTML = html;
  return temp.textContent.trim();
" --format raw

docs.title: Data Validation
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.item'))
    .map(item => ({
      title: item.querySelector('.title')?.textContent.trim(),
      link: item.querySelector('a')?.href
    }))
    .filter(item => item.title && item.link);  // Remove incomplete
" --format json

docs.title: URL Normalization
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  Array.from(document.links).map(a => {
    try {
      return new URL(a.href).href;  // Normalize URL
    } catch {
      return null;
    }
  }).filter(Boolean);
" --format json

docs.title: Scrape Multiple Pages
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Extract data from multiple pages

URLS=(
  "https://example.com/page1"
  "https://example.com/page2"
  "https://example.com/page3"
)

for url in "${URLS[@]}"; do
  echo "Extracting: $url"
  inspekt open "$url" --wait
  inspekt eval "({title: document.title, links: document.links.length})" --format json >> data.jsonl
done

docs.title: Export All Page Data
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Complete page export

PAGE_URL=$(inspekt eval "location.href" --format raw)
PAGE_TITLE=$(inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw)

mkdir -p "export/${PAGE_TITLE}"

# Links
inspekt links --json > "export/${PAGE_TITLE}/links.json"

# Outline
inspekt outline > "export/${PAGE_TITLE}/outline.txt"

# Metadata
inspekt info --json > "export/${PAGE_TITLE}/info.json"

# Screenshots
inspekt screenshot --selector "body" --output "export/${PAGE_TITLE}/screenshot.png"

echo "Exported: ${PAGE_TITLE}"

  Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.item'))
    .slice(0, 100)  // First 100 only
    .map(item => item.textContent)
" --format json

  const container = document.querySelector('.container');
  const items = container.querySelectorAll('.item');  // Query once

    title: item.querySelector('.title').textContent,
    link: item.querySelector('a').href

"

docs.title: Element Interaction
docs.text: Master element interaction in Inspekt. Learn how to click, inspect, highlight, wait for elements, send keyboard input, and take screenshots - all from your terminal.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Inspekt provides specialized commands for interacting with page elements:

  • inspekt click - Click elements
  • inspekt double-click / inspekt right-click - Double-click and right-click
  • inspekt wait - Wait for elements to appear/disappear
  • inspekt send - Type text into elements
  • inspekt inspect / inspekt inspected - Inspect elements
  • inspekt highlight - Highlight elements visually
  • inspekt screenshot - Screenshot elements

docs.title: Basic Click
docs.text:
inspekt click "button#submit"

Clicks the first element matching the selector.

docs.title: Click Examples
docs.text:
# Click button by ID
inspekt click "#submit-btn"

# Click link by class
inspekt click ".nav-link"

# Click by complex selector
inspekt click "nav > ul > li:first-child > a"

# Click by attribute
inspekt click "[data-action='delete']"

# Click by text content (using eval)
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('button')).find(b => b.textContent.includes('Submit')).click()"

docs.title: Using Inspected Element
docs.text:
You can click the currently inspected element (from DevTools):

# In DevTools, select an element ($0)
# In browser console: zenStore($0)

# Then click it
inspekt click
# or explicitly
inspekt click "$0"

docs.title: Double Click
docs.text:
Double-click elements for actions that require it:

inspekt double-click "div.editable"
inspekt double-click ".file-item"

docs.title: Right Click (Context Menu)

Trigger context menus:

inspekt right-click "a.download-link"
inspekt right-click ".file-item"

Click Types

  • inspekt click - Single left click
  • inspekt double-click - Double left click
  • inspekt right-click - Right click (context menu)

docs.title: Wait Use Cases
docs.text:
Wait for page load:

# Wait for spinner to disappear
inspekt wait ".spinner" --hidden

Timeout Default

Default timeout is 30 seconds. Adjust with --timeout flag.

docs.title: Typing Speed
docs.text:
The send command types at a realistic speed (character by character). For instant value setting, use inspekt eval:

docs.text:
You can also store the currently selected element in DevTools:

  1. Open DevTools (F12)
  2. Select an element (inspect tool or click in Elements panel)
  3. In console, run: zenStore($0)
  4. Then use: inspekt inspected

Workflow

Use inspekt inspect to find elements programmatically, or use DevTools + zenStore($0) for visual selection.

  }

docs.title: Wait with Polling
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  async function waitForElement(selector, timeout = 30000) {
    const start = Date.now();
    while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
      const element = document.querySelector(selector);
      if (element) return element;
      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 100));
    }
    throw new Error('Timeout');
  }

  const element = await waitForElement('.dynamic-content');
  return element.textContent;
"

docs.title: Hover Simulation
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  const element = document.querySelector('.menu-item');
  const event = new MouseEvent('mouseover', {
    bubbles: true,
    cancelable: true,
    view: window
  });
  element.dispatchEvent(event);
  return 'Hovered over element';
"

docs.title: Focus and Blur
docs.text:
# Focus element

docs.title: Element Not Found
docs.text:
Error: 

Error: Element not found: .missing-selector

Solutions: 1. Verify selector is correct 2. Wait for element to load: inspekt wait ".selector" --visible 3. Check if element is in iframe (not supported directly) 4. Use DevTools to test selector

docs.title: Click Not Working
docs.text:
Possible causes: - Element is not visible - Element is disabled - JavaScript event handler expecting different event - Element is covered by another element

Solutions: 

# Check if visible
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.btn')?.offsetParent !== null"

# Check if disabled
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.btn')?.disabled"

# Force click with JavaScript
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.btn').click()"

# Dispatch click event
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.btn').dispatchEvent(new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true}))"

docs.title: Element Changes After Action
docs.text:
Some elements are replaced after interaction (e.g., React re-renders). Re-select after action:

# Wrong - selector may be stale
inspekt click ".btn"
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.btn').textContent"

# Correct - re-select after action
inspekt click ".btn"
inspekt wait ".success-message" --visible
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.success-message').textContent"

inspekt click "button"

docs.title: 4. Verify Actions
docs.text:

inspekt click "#submit-btn"
inspekt wait ".success-message" --visible --text "Saved"

docs.title: JavaScript Execution
docs.text: Master JavaScript execution in Inspekt. Learn inline code execution, file execution, stdin piping, timeout handling, error handling, output formatting, and advanced patterns.

docs.title: Execution Methods
docs.text: Inspekt offers three ways to execute JavaScript code in your browser.

docs.title: 1. Inline Code Execution
docs.text:
Execute code directly from the command line:

inspekt eval "document.title"

Best for: - Quick one-liners - Testing expressions - Shell scripts with short code snippets

docs.title: 2. File Execution
docs.text:
Execute code from JavaScript files:

inspekt eval --file script.js
# or
inspekt exec script.js

Best for: - Complex scripts - Reusable code - Version-controlled automation

docs.title: 3. stdin Piping
docs.text:
Pipe code from stdin:

cat script.js | inspekt eval
echo "document.title" | inspekt eval

Best for: - Generated code - Dynamic scripts - Shell pipelines

docs.title: Simple Expressions
docs.text:
# Get page title
inspekt eval "document.title"

# Get URL
inspekt eval "window.location.href"

# Count elements
inspekt eval "document.querySelectorAll('a').length"

# Check if element exists
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.modal') !== null"

docs.title: Complex Expressions
docs.text:
# Array operations
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).map(a => a.href)"

# Object literals (wrap in parentheses)
inspekt eval "({title: document.title, url: location.href})"

# Filter and map
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('img')).filter(img => img.alt).map(img => img.src)"

# Reduce
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).reduce((acc, link) => acc + link.textContent.length, 0)"

docs.title: Multi-line Code
docs.text:
Use newlines and proper JavaScript syntax:

inspekt eval "
  const products = document.querySelectorAll('.product');
  const data = Array.from(products).map(p => ({
    name: p.querySelector('.name').textContent,
    price: p.querySelector('.price').textContent
  }));
  return data;
"

Multi-line Tips

  • Separate statements with semicolons
  • Use return for the final value
  • Proper indentation makes code readable

docs.title: Handling Quotes
docs.text:
Shell quoting can be tricky. Here are the rules:

# Double quotes - escape inner double quotes
inspekt eval "document.querySelector(\"h1\").textContent"

# Single quotes in double quotes - no escaping needed
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('h1').textContent"

# Backticks for template literals - use single quotes outside
inspekt eval 'document.querySelector("h1").textContent = `Hello ${name}`'

# Heredoc for complex quoting
inspekt eval <<'EOF'
const selector = 'div[data-value="complex"]';
const element = document.querySelector(selector);
return element?.textContent;
EOF

docs.title: Basic File Execution
docs.text:
script.js: 

// Extract all links
const links = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('a'));
return links.map(link => ({
  text: link.textContent.trim(),
  href: link.href,
  external: link.hostname !== location.hostname
}));

Execute: 

inspekt exec script.js
# or
inspekt eval --file script.js

docs.title: File with Modules
docs.text:
Modern JavaScript syntax is supported:

extract-data.js: 

// Extract product data with validation
const products = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.product'));

function extractProduct(element) {
  const name = element.querySelector('.product-name')?.textContent?.trim();
  const price = element.querySelector('.product-price')?.textContent?.trim();
  const image = element.querySelector('.product-image')?.src;

  // Validate required fields
  if (!name || !price) return null;

  return { name, price, image };
}

const data = products.map(extractProduct).filter(Boolean);

return {
  count: data.length,
  products: data,
  extracted: new Date().toISOString()
};

docs.title: Built-in Scripts
docs.text:
Inspekt includes several ready-to-use scripts in the zen/scripts/ directory:

# Extract all images
inspekt exec zen/scripts/extract_images.js

# Extract table data
inspekt exec zen/scripts/extract_table.js

# Get SEO metadata
inspekt exec zen/scripts/extract_metadata.js

# Performance metrics
inspekt exec zen/scripts/performance_metrics.js

# Inject jQuery
inspekt exec zen/scripts/inject_jquery.js

# Highlight elements
inspekt exec zen/scripts/highlight_selector.js

docs.title: Creating Your Own Scripts
docs.text:
1. Create a script directory: 

mkdir -p ~/zen-scripts

2. Write your script: 

// ~/zen-scripts/extract-prices.js
const prices = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.price'));
return prices.map(p => ({
  text: p.textContent,
  value: parseFloat(p.textContent.replace(/[^0-9.]/g, ''))
}));

3. Execute: 

inspekt exec ~/zen-scripts/extract-prices.js --format json

docs.title: Pipe from Files
docs.text: cat script.js | inspekt eval

docs.title: Pipe from echo
docs.text: echo "document.title" | inspekt eval

docs.title: Generate Code Dynamically
docs.text:
# Generate selector from variable
SELECTOR=".product"
echo "document.querySelectorAll('$SELECTOR').length" | inspekt eval

# Generate complex code
cat <<EOF | inspekt eval
const selector = '$SELECTOR';
const elements = document.querySelectorAll(selector);
return Array.from(elements).length;
EOF

docs.title: Pipe Chains
docs.text:
# Extract, filter, execute
grep -v "^//" script.js | inspekt eval

# Combine multiple commands
echo "document.links.length" | inspekt eval | awk '{print "Found " $1 " links"}'

docs.title: Default Timeout
docs.text:
Commands timeout after 10 seconds by default:

inspekt eval "document.title"  # 10 second timeout

docs.title: Custom Timeout
docs.text:
Adjust for slow operations:

# 30 second timeout
inspekt eval "await fetch('/api/data').then(r => r.json())" --timeout 30

# 5 second timeout (strict)
inspekt eval "document.title" --timeout 5

# 60 second timeout (very slow operations)
inspekt eval "await heavyComputation()" --timeout 60

docs.title: Timeout Examples
docs.text:
Long-running API call: 

inspekt eval "
  const response = await fetch('/api/large-dataset');
  const data = await response.json();
  return data.items.length;
" --timeout 30

Wait for lazy-loaded content: 

inspekt eval "
  // Scroll to load content
  for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight);
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));
  }
  return document.querySelectorAll('.lazy-item').length;
" --timeout 30

docs.title: Timeout Errors
docs.text:
When a timeout occurs:

Error: Request timed out after 10 seconds

Solutions: 1. Increase timeout with --timeout 2. Optimize your JavaScript code 3. Break into smaller operations 4. Check for infinite loops

docs.title: JavaScript Errors
docs.text:
Runtime errors are caught and displayed:

inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.missing').click()"

Output: 

TypeError: Cannot read property 'click' of null
  at <eval>:1:42

docs.title: Syntax Errors
docs.text:
Invalid JavaScript is caught:

inspekt eval "document..title"

Output: 

SyntaxError: Unexpected token '.'

docs.title: Handling Errors in Your Code
docs.text:
Use try-catch for graceful error handling:

inspekt eval "
  try {
    const element = document.querySelector('.maybe-exists');
    return element.textContent;
  } catch (error) {
    return null;
  }
"

docs.title: Defensive Coding
docs.text:
Use optional chaining and nullish coalescing:

# Optional chaining
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.modal')?.textContent"

# Nullish coalescing
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.price')?.textContent ?? 'N/A'"

# Combined
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.product')?.querySelector('.price')?.textContent ?? 'No price'"

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
Validate before operating:

inspekt eval "
  const element = document.querySelector('.submit-btn');
  if (!element) {
    return { error: 'Button not found' };
  }
  element.click();
  return { success: true };
"

docs.title: Format Options
docs.text:
Control output format with the --format flag:

Format Description Use Case auto Smart formatting (default) General use json Valid JSON Scripting, piping to jq raw Plain text Shell variables

docs.title: Auto Format (Default)
docs.text:
Intelligently formats output:

inspekt eval "document.title"
# Output: Example Domain (plain text)

inspekt eval "({title: document.title, url: location.href})"
# Output: Pretty-printed JSON

docs.title: JSON Format
docs.text:
Always outputs valid JSON:

inspekt eval "document.title" --format json
# Output: "Example Domain"

inspekt eval "({title: document.title, links: document.links.length})" --format json
# Output: {"title":"Example Domain","links":15}

Perfect for jq: 

inspekt eval "({title: document.title, url: location.href})" --format json | jq '.title'
# Output: "Example Domain"

docs.title: Raw Format
docs.text:
No formatting - just the value:

inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw
# Output: Example Domain

inspekt eval "document.links.length" --format raw
# Output: 15

Perfect for shell variables: 

TITLE=$(inspekt eval "document.title" --format raw)
COUNT=$(inspekt eval "document.links.length" --format raw)
echo "$COUNT links on $TITLE"

docs.title: Metadata Flags
docs.text:
Add context to output:

# Add URL
inspekt eval "document.title" --url

# Add title
inspekt eval "document.links.length" --title

# Add both
inspekt eval "document.links.length" --url --title

Output: 

URL: https://example.com
Title: Example Domain

15

docs.title: Async/Await
docs.text:
Full support for promises and async/await:

# Fetch API
inspekt eval "await fetch('/api/data').then(r => r.json())"

# Multiple awaits
inspekt eval "
  const response = await fetch('/api/users');
  const users = await response.json();
  return users.length;
"

# Promise.all
inspekt eval "
  const promises = Array.from({length: 5}, (_, i) =>
    fetch(\`/api/item/\${i}\`).then(r => r.json())
  );
  return await Promise.all(promises);
"

docs.title: Working with Arrays
docs.text:
# Map
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('a')).map(a => a.href)"

# Filter
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).filter(a => a.hostname === location.hostname)"

# Reduce
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.images).reduce((sum, img) => sum + img.naturalWidth, 0)"

# Find
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).find(a => a.textContent.includes('Contact'))"

# Some/Every
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.images).every(img => img.alt)"

docs.title: Working with Objects
docs.text:
# Object.keys
inspekt eval "Object.keys(window)"

# Object.entries
inspekt eval "Object.entries(localStorage).map(([k,v]) => ({key: k, value: v}))"

# Destructuring
inspekt eval "
  const {title, URL: url} = document;
  return {title, url};
"

docs.title: DOM Traversal
docs.text:
# Parent
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.child').parentElement.tagName"

# Children
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.body.children).map(el => el.tagName)"

# Siblings
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('h1').nextElementSibling?.tagName"

# Closest
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.nested').closest('.container')?.className"

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
Cache selectors: 

inspekt eval "
  const products = document.querySelectorAll('.product');
  return Array.from(products).map(p => {
    // Reuse 'p' instead of querying again
    return {
      name: p.querySelector('.name').textContent,
      price: p.querySelector('.price').textContent
    };
  });
"

Use document fragments: 

inspekt eval "
  const fragment = document.createDocumentFragment();
  for (let i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
    const div = document.createElement('div');
    div.textContent = i;
    fragment.appendChild(div);
  }
  document.body.appendChild(fragment);
  return 'Added 100 divs efficiently';
"

docs.title: Data Transformation
docs.text:
CSV Generation: 

inspekt eval "
  const rows = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('table tr'));
  return rows.map(row =>
    Array.from(row.cells).map(cell => cell.textContent).join(',')
  ).join('\n');
" --format raw > data.csv

JSON Transformation: 

inspekt eval "
  const links = Array.from(document.links);
  return links.reduce((acc, link) => {
    acc[link.textContent] = link.href;
    return acc;
  }, {});
" --format json

docs.title: State Management
docs.text:
Store data globally: 

# Set
inspekt eval "window.zenData = {extracted: Date.now(), items: [1,2,3]}"

# Get
inspekt eval "window.zenData"

# Update
inspekt eval "window.zenData.items.push(4); window.zenData"

docs.title: Console Integration
docs.text:
# Log to browser console
inspekt eval "console.log('Debug:', document.title); document.title"

# Console table
inspekt eval "
  const data = Array.from(document.links).slice(0, 5).map(a => ({
    text: a.textContent,
    href: a.href
  }));
  console.table(data);
  return data.length;
"

# Console time
inspekt eval "
  console.time('query');
  const result = document.querySelectorAll('*').length;
  console.timeEnd('query');
  return result;
"

docs.title: Browser APIs
docs.text:
Local Storage: 

inspekt eval "localStorage.getItem('token')"
inspekt eval "localStorage.setItem('key', 'value')"
inspekt eval "Object.keys(localStorage)"

Cookies: 

inspekt eval "document.cookie"
inspekt eval "document.cookie.split(';').length"

Performance API: 

inspekt eval "performance.now()"
inspekt eval "performance.memory.usedJSHeapSize"
inspekt eval "performance.timing.loadEventEnd - performance.timing.navigationStart"

Clipboard API: 

inspekt eval "await navigator.clipboard.readText()"
inspekt eval "await navigator.clipboard.writeText('Hello from CLI')"

docs.title: 1. Return Structured Data
docs.text:
# Good - structured return
inspekt eval "
  return {
    success: true,
    count: document.links.length,
    timestamp: Date.now()
  };
"

# Avoid - multiple console.logs
inspekt eval "
  console.log('Links:', document.links.length);
  console.log('Images:', document.images.length);
"

docs.title: 2. Use Meaningful Variable Names
docs.text:
# Good
inspekt eval "
  const productElements = document.querySelectorAll('.product');
  const productData = Array.from(productElements).map(extractProductInfo);
  return productData;
"

# Avoid
inspekt eval "
  const a = document.querySelectorAll('.product');
  const b = Array.from(a).map(c => extractProductInfo(c));
  return b;
"

docs.title: 3. Handle Edge Cases
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  const element = document.querySelector('.may-not-exist');
  if (!element) {
    return { error: 'Element not found' };
  }
  return { text: element.textContent };
"

docs.title: 4. Comment Complex Code
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  // Extract all external links
  const allLinks = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('a'));

  // Filter to external only
  const externalLinks = allLinks.filter(link =>
    link.hostname !== location.hostname && link.hostname !== ''
  );

  // Return count and sample
  return {
    total: externalLinks.length,
    sample: externalLinks.slice(0, 5).map(l => l.href)
  };
"

docs.title: 5. Use Functions for Reusability
docs.text:
script.js: 

function extractProductData(selector) {
  const products = document.querySelectorAll(selector);
  return Array.from(products).map(product => ({
    name: product.querySelector('.name')?.textContent?.trim(),
    price: product.querySelector('.price')?.textContent?.trim(),
    available: !product.classList.contains('out-of-stock')
  })).filter(p => p.name && p.price);
}

return extractProductData('.product-item');

docs.title: 1. Use Browser DevTools
docs.text: Open browser console while running commands to see: - console.log() output - JavaScript errors with stack traces - Network requests - Performance metrics

docs.title: 2. Test in REPL First
docs.text:
inspekt repl
zen> document.querySelector('.complex-selector')
zen> Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.items')).length
zen> exit

docs.title: 3. Break Down Complex Code
docs.text:
# Step 1: Test selector
inspekt eval "document.querySelectorAll('.product').length"

# Step 2: Test extraction
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.product .name').textContent"

# Step 3: Combine
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.product')).map(p => p.querySelector('.name').textContent)"

docs.title: 4. Add Debug Output
docs.text:
inspekt eval "
  console.log('Starting extraction...');
  const products = document.querySelectorAll('.product');
  console.log('Found products:', products.length);
  const data = Array.from(products).map(p => {
    const name = p.querySelector('.name')?.textContent;
    console.log('Extracted:', name);
    return {name};
  });
  console.log('Complete:', data.length);
  return data;
"

docs.title: 1. Forgetting to Return
docs.text:
# Wrong - no return
inspekt eval "
  const links = document.querySelectorAll('a');
  links.length;
"
# Output: undefined

# Correct
inspekt eval "
  const links = document.querySelectorAll('a');
  return links.length;
"
# Output: 15

docs.title: 2. Async Without Await
docs.text:
# Wrong - returns Promise
inspekt eval "fetch('/api/data').then(r => r.json())"
# Output: [object Promise]

# Correct - await the promise
inspekt eval "await fetch('/api/data').then(r => r.json())"
# Output: {data: [...]}

docs.title: 3. Quoting Issues
docs.text:
# Wrong - quote mismatch
inspekt eval 'document.querySelector("div[data-id="123"]")'

# Correct - escape or use heredoc
inspekt eval "document.querySelector(\"div[data-id='123']\")"

docs.title: 4. Not Checking Null
docs.text:
# Wrong - may throw error
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.missing').click()"

# Correct - check first
inspekt eval "document.querySelector('.missing')?.click() ?? 'Element not found'"

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Welcome to Inspekt - a powerful CLI tool that lets you control your browser from the command line. Execute JavaScript, automate tasks, extract data, and interact with web pages without leaving your terminal.

docs.title: What is Inspekt?
docs.text:
Inspekt is a command-line interface that connects your terminal to your web browser through a WebSocket-based architecture. It allows you to:

  • Execute JavaScript code in your active browser tab
  • Interact with page elements (click, inspect, highlight, wait)
  • Extract data (links, images, tables, metadata)
  • Automate form filling and navigation
  • Debug and test web applications
  • Monitor browser activity in real-time
  • Control your browser entirely from your keyboard

Think of it as a bridge between your terminal and your browser - hence the name.

docs.title: 1. CLI Tool (Your Terminal)
docs.text:
When you run commands like inspekt eval "document.title", the CLI tool:

  • Parses your command and options
  • Formats the JavaScript code
  • Sends an HTTP request to the local server
  • Waits for the response
  • Displays the result

docs.title: 2. Bridge Server (Background Process)
docs.text:
The server acts as a message broker:

  • Listens for HTTP requests from the CLI (port 8765)
  • Maintains WebSocket connections with browser tabs (port 8766)
  • Routes commands to the active browser tab
  • Returns results back to the CLI
  • Runs in the background as a daemon

Start the server with: 

inspekt server start --daemon

docs.title: 3. Browser Userscript (In Your Browser)
docs.text:
A lightweight userscript runs in your browser:

  • Establishes a WebSocket connection to the server
  • Receives JavaScript code from the server
  • Executes the code in the page context
  • Sends results back to the server
  • Works across page navigations

The userscript must be installed in a userscript manager like Violentmonkey or Tampermonkey.

docs.title: Why WebSockets?
docs.text:
Traditional HTTP polling would be slow and inefficient. WebSockets provide:

  • Instant communication - No polling delays
  • Bi-directional - Server can push to browser, browser can push to server
  • Persistent connection - One connection serves multiple commands
  • Low overhead - Minimal latency compared to HTTP requests

docs.title: Message Flow Example
docs.text:
When you run inspekt eval "document.title":

  1. CLI → Server (HTTP) 

    POST http://127.0.0.1:8765/execute
{
  "code": "document.title",
  "timeout": 10
}

  2. Server → Browser (WebSocket) 

    {
  "type": "execute",
  "code": "document.title",
  "id": "req-123"
}

  3. Browser executes code and responds (WebSocket) 

    {
  "type": "response",
  "id": "req-123",
  "result": "Example Domain",
  "ok": true
}

  4. Server → CLI (HTTP Response) 

    {
  "ok": true,
  "result": "Example Domain"
}

  5. CLI displays output 

    Example Domain

docs.title: Security Considerations
docs.text:
The WebSocket connection is local only:

  • Server binds to 127.0.0.1 (localhost)
  • Not accessible from external networks
  • No authentication needed (local-only access)
  • Userscript only connects to localhost

This means Inspekt can only control browsers on your own machine.

docs.title: When to Use Inspekt
docs.text: Inspekt is ideal for:

docs.title: Web Development & Debugging
docs.text:
• Inspect application state (window.myApp, Redux stores)
  • Test JavaScript functions interactively
  • Debug DOM manipulations
  • Monitor performance metrics
  • Inject jQuery or other libraries for testing

docs.title: Web Scraping & Data Extraction
docs.text:
• Extract data from authenticated pages (logged-in dashboards)
  • Scrape tables, lists, and structured data
  • Download files (images, PDFs, videos)
  • Extract metadata (Open Graph, Twitter Cards)
  • Monitor page changes over time

docs.title: Browser Automation
docs.text:
• Fill and submit forms
  • Navigate through multi-page workflows
  • Click buttons and interact with elements
  • Wait for dynamic content to load
  • Automate repetitive tasks

docs.title: Accessibility Testing
docs.text:
• Check heading structure (inspekt outline)
  • Find images without alt text
  • Test keyboard navigation (inspekt control)
  • Generate page descriptions for screen readers

docs.title: Content Analysis
docs.text:
• Generate AI summaries of articles (inspekt summarize)
  • Get concise page descriptions (inspekt describe)
  • Analyze link structures
  • Check SEO metadata

docs.title: Shell Scripting & CI/CD
docs.text:
• Integrate browser data into shell scripts
  • Monitor build dashboards
  • Automate visual regression testing
  • Extract data for reports

docs.title: When NOT to Use Inspekt
docs.text: Inspekt is not suitable for:

docs.title: Heavy Automation at Scale
docs.text:
• Use Playwright or Puppeteer for:
  • Running hundreds of parallel browser instances
  • Server-side rendering testing
  • Complex test suites with retries and parallelization

docs.title: Distributed/Remote Automation
docs.text:
• Inspekt only works on localhost
  • For remote browser control, use Playwright, Puppeteer, or Selenium Grid

docs.title: Production Monitoring
docs.text:
• Don't rely on Inspekt for production monitoring
  • Use proper APM tools (Datadog, New Relic, etc.)

docs.title: Privacy-Sensitive Operations
docs.text:
• Inspekt has access to everything in your browser
  • Don't use it on pages with sensitive credentials
  • Be careful with commands that extract cookies or local storage

docs.title: Execute JavaScript
docs.text:
Run any JavaScript code in your browser:

inspekt eval "document.title"
inspekt eval "Array.from(document.links).map(a => a.href)"
inspekt eval "({url: location.href, title: document.title})" --format json

docs.title: Interactive REPL
docs.text:
Live JavaScript session:

inspekt repl
zen> document.querySelectorAll('p').length
2
zen> exit

docs.title: Element Interaction
docs.text:
Click, inspect, highlight, and wait for elements:

inspekt click "button#submit"
inspekt inspect "h1"
inspekt highlight ".error" --color red
inspekt wait ".modal" --visible

docs.title: Data Extraction
docs.text:
Extract structured data:

inspekt links --only-external
inspekt outline
inspekt download
inspekt info --extended

docs.title: AI-Powered Features
docs.text:
Summarize and describe pages:

inspekt summarize
inspekt describe

Requires mods for AI integration.

docs.title: Keyboard Control
docs.text:
Navigate entirely from your keyboard:

inspekt control
# Use Tab, Enter, Arrow keys to navigate
# Press 'q' to quit

docs.title: Real-Time Monitoring
docs.text:
Watch browser activity:

inspekt watch input  # Monitor keyboard input
inspekt watch all    # Monitor all interactions

docs.title: Architecture Benefits
docs.text:
Inspekt follows a hexagonal architecture with clear separation of concerns:

  • Domain Layer - Pure business logic with Pydantic models
  • Adapter Layer - I/O operations (filesystem, WebSocket)
  • Service Layer - Application services and orchestration
  • Application Layer - CLI commands and server

This design ensures:

  • High testability (97%+ coverage on services)
  • Clear dependencies (no circular imports)
  • Easy extensibility (add new commands/services)
  • Maintainable codebase

See Architecture Guide for technical details.
